p: Periodontal diseases are chronic inflammatory disorders of bacterial origin that affect tooth-supporting tissues [ 7]. Over 700 bacterial species that have been identified in the oral cavity [ 8], only a few are associated with periodontitis, including Porphyromonas gingivalis [ 9]. P. gingivalis is a gram-negative bacterium closely associated with chronic periodontitis. High numbers of P. gingivalis, together with other periodontopathogens, induce a host immune response, which in turn leads to a destructive inflammatory process.
